label: Public Safety
description: The paramount obligation of engineers to prioritize the safety, health, and welfare of the public above all other considerations in their professional work.
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public.
Engineers shall hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public.
Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property.

label: Professional Competence
description: The obligation of engineers to only perform services in areas where they possess adequate knowledge, skills, and expertise.
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence.
Engineers shall perform services only in areas of their competence.
Accept only qualified assignments.
Do not sign off on work outside area of expertise.

label: Truthfulness
description: The requirement for engineers to communicate honestly and objectively in all professional statements, avoiding deception or misrepresentation.
text_references: Issue public statements only in an objective and truthful manner.
Engineers shall issue public statements only in an objective and truthful manner.
Be objective and include all pertinent facts in statements or testimony.
Express opinions based on facts and competence.

label: Fidelity
description: The duty of engineers to act as faithful agents or trustees for their employers or clients, maintaining loyalty and trust.
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees.
Engineers shall act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees.
Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest.

label: Honesty and Integrity
description: The core ethical values that should guide all engineering practice, requiring truthfulness, moral uprightness, and adherence to strong moral principles.
text_references: Engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity.
Engineers shall be guided by honesty and integrity.
Admit and correct errors.
Avoid deceptive acts.

label: Conflict of Interest
description: Situations where an engineer's personal interests or obligations conflict with professional responsibilities, requiring disclosure and management.
text_references: Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest.
Accept multiple compensations only with full disclosure.
Do not accept gifts or considerations from outside agents.
Avoid decision-making in public positions involving own interests.

label: Confidentiality
description: The obligation to protect and not disclose private or proprietary information obtained during professional service without proper authorization.
text_references: Do not disclose client/employer information without consent or legal obligation.
Engineers shall maintain confidentiality.
Do not share confidential information without consent.
Avoid conflicts in new employment with specialized knowledge.

label: Public
description: The general population whose safety, health, and welfare engineers must prioritize in their professional work.
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public.
Engineering has a direct and vital impact on the quality of life for all people.
Engineers shall strive to serve the public interest.

label: Employer/Client
description: Organizations or individuals who engage engineering services and to whom engineers owe duties of loyalty and competent service.
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees.
Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property.
Warn employers or clients of project issues.

label: Professional Colleagues
description: Other engineers and professionals with whom engineers interact and to whom they owe respect and fair treatment.
text_references: Engineers shall not harm others' professional reputation.
Do not review another engineer's work without disclosure.
Engineers shall credit others appropriately.
Name individuals responsible for work when possible.

label: Whistleblowing
description: The ethical obligation to report violations or dangerous conditions to appropriate authorities when public safety is at risk.
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property.
Report known code violations to professional or public bodies.
Refuse to sign non-compliant documents and report pressure.

label: Professional Development
description: The ongoing commitment to maintain and improve professional knowledge, skills, and expertise throughout one's career.
text_references: Commit to ongoing professional development.

label: Sustainability
description: The consideration of environmental, social, and economic impacts of engineering work to meet present needs without compromising future generations.
text_references: Support sustainability.

label: Professional Reputation
description: The collective standing and perception of the engineering profession, which individual engineers have a duty to uphold and enhance.
text_references: Conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully so as to enhance the honor, reputation, and usefulness of the profession.
Uphold professional dignity.

label: Intellectual Property
description: The rights related to creations of the mind, including engineering designs, processes, and documentation, which must be respected and properly attributed.
text_references: Respect proprietary rights of clients.
Set ownership expectations clearly.
Understand employer retains rights to exclusive work materials.

label: Fairness and Equity
description: The principles of impartial and just treatment of all individuals in engineering practice and decision-making.
text_references: The services provided by engineers require honesty, impartiality, fairness, and equity.
Treat all individuals with fairness and respect.

label: Public Education
description: The responsibility of engineers to promote public understanding of engineering and its impact on society.
text_references: Engage in civic and educational outreach.
Promote public understanding of engineering.

label: Improper Financial Gain
description: The prohibition against seeking professional advantage through unethical financial arrangements or improper use of resources.
text_references: Do not offer bribes or commissions to secure contracts.
Reject inducements from suppliers.
Refuse commissions from contractors related to work.
Avoid contingent fee arrangements that compromise ethics.
Do not misuse employer resources for personal practice.

label: Professional Accountability
description: The willingness to take responsibility for one's professional actions and decisions, including admitting and correcting errors.
text_references: Engineers shall accept responsibility for their actions.
Admit and correct errors.
Follow registration laws.
Avoid unethical acts under corporate cover.

label: Credit Attribution
description: The ethical requirement to properly acknowledge the contributions and work of others in engineering projects and publications.
text_references: Engineers shall credit others appropriately.
Name individuals responsible for work when possible.
Acknowledge contributions of others.

label: Legal Compliance
description: The obligation of engineers to adhere to applicable laws, regulations, and professional standards in their practice.
text_references: Conduct themselves honorably, responsibly, ethically, and lawfully.
Follow registration laws.
Do not aid in unlawful engineering practice.
